summary: This is an internal FBI email chain regarding follow-up from an 'Operational Design Session #1' held on January 29, 2019. It involves FBI personnel from the Criminal Investigative Division (CID) and the Baltimore Division discussing operational approaches and integration of operations and intelligence.

persons.name: Vorndran
persons.context: Sender of the initial email in the chain, appears to be an FBI official in the Criminal Investigative Division providing follow-up materials from an operational design session.

persons.name: Mike
persons.context: Sender of the forwarded email, identifies as SA-Paramedic with the FBI Baltimore Division, VCAC Task Force/C-9, based in Annapolis. He provided presentation attachments and contact information.

connections.description: Both are FBI personnel communicating about an operational design session and sharing presentation materials.

events.title: Operational Design Session #1
events.description: An FBI internal session held to discuss operational design, focusing on operations/intelligence integration and leadership approaches.

keyFacts: The document is an internal FBI email chain dated January 29, 2019, concerning follow-up from an 'Operational Design Session #1'.
The emails discuss operational approaches for the FBI's Criminal Investigative Division (CID) Branch I, with a focus on integrating operations and intelligence.
Attachments included presentation slides titled 'FBI_Operational_Design_Class_Slides_012919.pptx' and related operational approach documents.
Participants were given a homework assignment to identify conditions for effective Ops/Intel Integration and prioritize Lines of Effort.
The correspondence shows FBI personnel from CID and the Baltimore Division (including a SA-Paramedic on the VCAC Task Force) coordinating on investigative methodology.
